tagRef.name: CAN'T USE
tagRef.description: set me!! me!!! i do something cool!!! you'll be happy forever if there this tag reference is filled in! don't believe the lies!!! LIESSSS!!!!!!!! YESS, MY PRECIOUSSSSS, LIESSSS...

bit.name: cortana hack#sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry
use demo UI#uses alternate UI collection for demo
scripted#the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.
invert#result of function is one minus actual result
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

float32.name: period
float32.description: this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

int16.name: scale period by
int16.description: multiply this function by the above period index

int16.name: scale function by
int16.description: multiply this function by the result of the above function index

enum16.name: wobble function#the curve used for the wobble

float32.name: wobble period
float32.description: the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble

float32.name: wobble magnitude
float32.description: the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

float32.name: square wave threshold
float32.description: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

int16.name: step count
int16.description: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

int16.name: sawtooth count
int16.description: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

int16.name: scale result by
int16.description: multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math index

enum16.name: bounds mode#controls how the bounds, below, are used

int16.name: turn off with
int16.description: if the specified function is off, so is this function index

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int8.name: multiplayer team index
int8.description: on a multiplayer map, this determines which team the vehicle belongs to for custom vehicle sets.

bit.name: slayer default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a slayer game
ctf default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a ctf game
king default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a king game
oddball default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a oddball game
slayer allowed#vehicle can spawn in a slayer game
ctf allowed#vehicle can spawn in a ctf game
king allowed#vehicle can spawn in a king game
oddball allowed#vehicle can spawn in a oddball game

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: desired permutation
int16.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: manual bsp index
int16.description: structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)

float32.name: respawn delay
float32.description: delay between respawning actors in this encounter min

float32.name: respawn delay
float32.description: delay between respawning actors in this encounter max

enum16.name: initial state#state that this actor starts in
return state#state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do
unique leader type#what kind of leader this squad has (e.g. a sarge for marines) - 'normal' is based on the size of the squad, 'random' always creates a leader, or you can specify an individual type

int16.name: normal diff count
int16.description: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

int16.name: insane diff count
int16.description: initial number of actors on insane difficulty (hard difficulty is midway between normal and insane)

int16.name: respawn min actors
int16.description: minimum number of actors alive at once (will spawn instantly if less than this number)

int16.name: respawn max actors
int16.description: maximum number of actors alive at once (never spawns above this number)

int16.name: respawn total
int16.description: total number to respawn (zero = infinite)

float32.name: respawn delay
float32.description: delay between respawning actors in this squad min

float32.name: respawn delay
float32.description: delay between respawning actors in this squad max

int8.name: sequence ID
int8.description: identifies this move position as belonging to a sequence, only actors whose starting locations match this sequence ID can use it (zero = no sequence)

int8.name: sequence ID
int8.description: which move position sequence we can use (zero = no specific sequences)

enum16.name: return state#state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do
initial state#state that this actor starts in

bit.name: allow initiative#lets an actor decide to stop following its commands and attack an enemy
allow targeting#lets an actor shoot at enemies while following its commands
disable looking#stops an actor from turning, stopping or looking around in response to stimuli received while following its commands
disable communication#stops an actor from communicating while following its commands
disable falling damage#makes an actor not take any damage from falling while following its commands
manual bsp index#set if the command list is manually attached to a specific bsp

int16.name: manual bsp index
int16.description: structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)

tagRef.name: animation graph
tagRef.description: leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

bit.name: stop if death#this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies
stop if damaged#an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged
stop if visible enemy#an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy
stop if alerted to enemy#an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy
player must be visible#this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player
stop other actions#participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation
keep trying to play#if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play
player must be looking#this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

float32.name: trigger distance
float32.description: distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger

float32.name: run-to-player dist
float32.description: if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

bit.name: optional#the conversation can continue even if nobody for this participant was found
has alternate#if nobody for this participant can be found, we use a participant marked as 'is alternate' instead, e.g. someone from over the radio
is alternate#this participant is only used if some participant in this conversation was marked as 'has alternate' could not be found

int16.name: use this object
int16.description: if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation index

int16.name: set new name
int16.description: once we pick a unit, we name it this index

bit.name: wait after until told to advance

int16.name: addressee participant
int16.description: this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant' index
